generalText: It a single web-page project, where I practiced implementation of DOM manipulations using Vanilla Javascript. My contribution to the project only includes JS code. Nevertheless, it was a great opportunity to develop the skills of adding listeners, changing styles and triggering transformation. All the other links displayed in the webpage are empty. The webpage was eventually deployed using Netlify platform and has only desktop format.
behindText: There are a couple of things that are happening behind the scenes. First of all, the page has various intersection observers working to make the page more dynamic on scroll. It makes each coming section of the page appear a little later after the scroll took place. It definitely enhances the UX.

Another feature is lazy images, which also happens thanks to the intersection observer and is not noticeable by the user. This way, page loading speed is increased dramatically. Menu fade animation occurs thanks to child/parent event propagation. The rest of the animations happen due to standard transform manipulations.
